Description: Silver wire torque: the ends beaten out into a wide flange and then curled up. Now broken into two pieces.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3120 Found around the neck of a woman.
Curator's comments: This grave, of an old woman, is remarkable for containing not only this torque but also two pairs of silver earrings. Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.237), beads and shell (1930,0711.233), pairs of ear-rings (1930,0711.235 & 1930,0711.236). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 116, 129; pl. LXXIV, 3ab; LXXV, 16; Tomb register, pl. LXX; The British Museum, 'Jewellery through 7000 years' [exhibition catalogue] (London, 1976), no. 28a.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (675)
